info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 20 at 2:21AM MDT until March 20 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Rapid City SD
info.description:
...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT /1 PM CDT/ TODAY TO 6 PM MDT /7 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 326, 332, 333, 334, AND 335...
.A system approaching the region today will bring gusty southwest to west winds to the area. Warm and dry air is expected over far southern South Dakota as minimum relative humidities drop to as low as 15 percent. Outside of very patchy leftover snowcover, fuels remain dry. These conditions will support critical fire weather conditions this afternoon over far southern South Dakota.
The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a Red Flag Warning for gusty winds and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon MDT /1 PM CDT/ today to 6 PM MDT /7 PM CDT/ this evening.
* AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 326 Pine Ridge Area, 332 Badlands Area, 333 Bennett County Area, 334 Mellette and Todd Counties and 335 Tripp County.
* WINDS...West to southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 45 mph.
* RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent.
* IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity would produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

parameter.value: RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON MDT /1 PM CDT/ TODAY TO 6 PM MDT /7 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 326, 332, 333, 334, AND 335

area.areaDesc: Pine Ridge Area; Badlands Area; Bennett County Area; Mellette and Todd Counties; Tripp County
